definition: butter tea (Tibetan, Mongolian etc drink derived from milk)
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning

sentences.english: Daniel, don't just drink you buttered tea.
sentences.chinese: 大牛，你別光顧着喝酥油茶。

sentences.english: Please try the milk tea of steppe.
sentences.chinese: 給你嚐嚐草原上的酥油茶。

sentences.english: Tibetan butter tea commonly used in hospitality, they drink butter tea, there is a set of rules.
sentences.chinese: 藏族常用酥油茶待客，他們喝酥油茶，還有一套規矩。

sentences.english: Tibetan butter tea commonly used in hospitality, they drink butter tea, there is a set of rules.
sentences.chinese: 藏族常用酥油茶待客，他們喝酥油茶，還有一套規矩。

sentences.english: The buttered tea is the Tibet area teas high-grade goods.
sentences.chinese: 酥油茶是藏區茶類的上品。

sentences.english: We can drink ghee tee at the herds' homes to have a rest.
sentences.chinese: 大家可以在牧民朋友的家裏，嚐嚐酥油茶，休息一下。

definition: hand-held mutton (mutton pieces on the bone, eaten with the fingers)

pilaf (rice dish popular in many parts of the world, including Xinjiang)/pilau

a kind of a flat bread
to stuff one's face/to eat greedily
a kind of rice-flour noodles from Yunnan province
